items.title: JPA projections inside entity
items.body:
I am working on an application which has an entity called Post. I also have a User Details entity which is mapped with createdBy column in Post entity. I have modeled their relation using @OneToOne annotation in Post entity.

public class Post {
  ... other fields

  @OneToOne
  @JoinColumn(name='created_by', referencedColumnName='id')
  public UserDetails createdBy;
}

public class UserDetails {
  public Integer id;
  public String name;
  ... other fields
}

When i fetch the Post entity, it is returning the user details entity also with all its fields. But i need to read only id and name from user details. I tried to use Projections to achieve this, but i am not able to use user details projection inside Post entity. Is it possible to use a projection inside an entity and map using @OneToOne? I am using spring-boot-starter-jpa for my project.

answers.body_markdown: In eclipse, you must be careful to create a "source folder" (File->New->Source Folder).  This way, it's automatically on your classpath, and, more importantly, Eclipse knows that these are compilable files.  It's picky that way.

answers.body_markdown:
I think it's because of the .classpath getting saved with the deleted source folder configuration. 

 1. Create the missing folder [ '`src`' in your case] manually inside the root of the project. When I say manually, I meant outside Eclipse, using the file explorer.

 2. Then, come back to eclipse and refresh the project. Now, the error saying it's already there will be gone.

 3. Now, Right click on the **project** > **Build Path** > **Configure Build path**. It should take us to the **Java build path** side menu.

 4. Make sure we are on the '**Source**' tab. Delete the source folder causing the problem. Now, maybe the folder might show up in the project structure and you may delete that too.

  2. Then, come back to eclipse and refresh the project. Now, the error saying it's already there will be gone.

  3. Now, Right click on the project > Build Path > Configure Build path. It should take us to the Java build path side menu.

  4. Make sure we are on the 'Source' tab. Delete the source folder causing the problem. Now, maybe the folder might show up in the project structure and you may delete that too.

And I am not able to receive the child node events (custom event) when subscribing to the Server Node. How to add these custom events under the Server node heirachy?

items.title: Spring Boot Controller Test wrongly returning status code 200 instead of 403
items.body:
Im currently working on a Spring Boot Rest API. I have a UserAdministrationController for managing users (adding, removing, editing).

In order to secure all related endpoints, I configure my App in the following way:

    protected SecurityFilterChain filterChain(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.httpBasic().and().csrf().disable().authorizeHttpRequests()
                .requestMatchers("/users/**").hasRole("ADMIN")
                .anyRequest().authenticated();
        return http.build();
    }


And for testing purposes I set up in-memory users:

@Bean
    public UserDetailsService userDetailsService() {
        UserDetails user = org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.User
                .withUsername("user")
                .password(bCryptPasswordEncoder().encode("password"))
                .roles("USER")
                .build();
        UserDetails user2 = org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.User
                .withUsername("admin")
                .password(bCryptPasswordEncoder().encode("password"))
                .roles("ADMIN")
                .build();
        return new InMemoryUserDetailsManager(user,user2);
    }

Additionally, I use @PreAuthorize for all my controller methods like that:

 @PutMapping("/users/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN')")
    public ResponseEntity<?> editUser(@PathVariable String id, @RequestBody User newUser) {
        User updatedUser = userAdministrationService.editUser(id, newUser);
        return ResponseEntity.ok(updatedUser);
    }

Now I want to test this endpoint and essentially I wanna see that whenever someone calls the endpoint without authorization, a 401 or 403. My test looks as follows:

@Test
    @WithMockUser("USER")
    void editUserTest() throws Exception {
        User modifiedUser = new User("lisa1", "pw", "email@test-mail.com");
        Mockito.when(userAdministrationService.getUserById(modifiedUser.getId())).thenReturn(Optional.of(modifiedUser));

        modifiedUser.setId("randomId");
        modifiedUser.setRole(Role.ROLE_USER);

        mockMvc.perform(put("/users/{id}", "randomId").with(user("user").roles("USER")).with(csrf()).contentType(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON).content(objectMapper.writeValueAsString(modifiedUser))).andExpect(status().isForbidden());
    }

So I kinda expect that when using the "USER" Role, I should receive the 403, but in that case I receive status 200. This is the output:

MockHttpServletRequest:
      HTTP Method = PUT
      Request URI = /users/randomId
       Parameters = {_csrf=[qS2FHI3G9z0WNlpkAdOU-q-iy3tBmukEaUsWQFiv5Qle90x-yx-1L-j3lVk7BmlRYv6gy5yX5kIirN8pUXkjcj2fhDhtzi5H]}
          Headers = [Content-Type:"application/json;charset=UTF-8", Content-Length:"198"]
             Body = {"email":"email@test-mail.com","password":"pw","username":"lisa1","role":"ROLE_USER","id":"randomId","enabled":false,"accountNonExpired":false,"credentialsNonExpired":false,"accountNonLocked":false}
    Session Attrs = {SPRING_SECURITY_CONTEXT=SecurityContextImpl [Authentication=UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken [Principal=org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.User [Username=user, Password=[PROTECTED], Enabled=true, AccountNonExpired=true, credentialsNonExpired=true, AccountNonLocked=true, Granted Authorities=[ROLE_USER]], Credentials=[PROTECTED], Authenticated=true, Details=null, Granted Authorities=[ROLE_USER]]]}

Handler:
             Type = com.example.server.controller.UserAdministrationController
           Method = com.example.server.controller.UserAdministrationController#editUser(String, User)

Async:
    Async started = false
     Async result = null

Resolved Exception:
             Type = null

ModelAndView:
        View name = null
             View = null
            Model = null

FlashMap:
       Attributes = null

MockHttpServletResponse:
           Status = 200
    Error message = null
          Headers = [X-Content-Type-Options:"nosniff", X-XSS-Protection:"0", Cache-Control:"no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate", Pragma:"no-cache", Expires:"0", X-Frame-Options:"DENY"]
     Content type = null
             Body = 
    Forwarded URL = null
   Redirected URL = null
          Cookies = []

java.lang.AssertionError: Status expected:<403> but was:<200>
Expected :403
Actual   :200

So this is my setup and for others tests it all works as expected, but Im not really sure whats wrong with my editUserTest.

I already tried to check wether the securitycontext returns an authorzied ROLE but it was correctly set to USER so it should still return 403, not 200.

In Postman its the same. Im using Basic auth with the in-memory "user" and it still authenticates me.

So right now Im kinda out of ideas. Anyone has a clue? Thanks a lot in advance and in cases more info is needed, let me know (still new to the whole stackoverflow thingy)

items.title: Query working in MongoDb using Aggregation but NOT in Springboot
items.body:
I am new in querying in mongoDb using aggregation and I am stuck with this problem:

My Springboot aggregation query could not fetch any data from mongo, but its equivalent query in mongoDbCompass can:

Here is a snippet of my springboot implementations.

public BookingResponse findAllBookingList(BookingRequest request) {
        int page = request.getPage() - 1;
        int limit = request.getLimit();
        String status = request.getStatus();

        Aggregation aggregation = null;

        if (StringUtils.isNotBlank(status)) {
            aggregation = Aggregation.newAggregation(
                Aggregation.unwind("milestones"),
                Aggregation.sort(Sort.by("_id", "milestones.updated_at").descending()),
                Aggregation.group("_id")
                    .first("_id").as("id")
                    .first("booking_number").as("bookingNumber")
                    .first("shipper_details").as("shipperDetails")
                    .first("milestones").as("latestMilestone"),
                Aggregation.match(Criteria.where("latestMilestone.status").is(status)),
                Aggregation.project("id", "bookingNumber", "shipperDetails", "latestMilestone.status")
                    .and("latestMilestone").as("milestones")
                    .and("latestMilestone.status").as("status")
            );
        } else {
            aggregation = Aggregation.newAggregation(
                Aggregation.sort(Sort.by("booked_at").descending()),
                Aggregation.project("id", "bookingNumber", "shipperDetails", "latestMilestone.status")
                    .and("latestMilestone").as("milestones")
                    .and("latestMilestone.status").as("status")
            );
        }

        AggregationResults<BookingEntity> results = mongoTemplate.aggregate(aggregation,
            "booking", BookingEntity.class);

        List<BookingEntity> resultList = results.getMappedResults();
        resultList.sort(Comparator.comparing(BookingEntity::getBookedAt).reversed());

        Page<BookingEntity> pageResult = new PageImpl<>(resultList,
            PageRequest.of(page, limit), resultList.size());

        return buildResponse(pageResult, request);
    }
    
    private BookingResponse buildResponse(Page<BookingEntity> results, BookingRequest request) {
        BookingResponse response = new BookingResponse();
        response.setMetadata(constructMetadata(results));
        response.setBookings(
            results.getContent()
                .stream()
                .map(bookingMapper::toDTO)
                .toList()
        );
        response.setStatusCounts(setStatusCount(results));

        return response;
    }

and here is it's equivalent query that is working in mongoDb Compass

[   {
    $unwind: "$milestones"   },   {
    $sort: {
      "_id": 1,
      "milestones.updated_at": -1
    }   },   {
    $group: {
      "_id": "$_id",
      "id": { "$first": "$_id" },
      "bookingNumber": { "$first": "$booking_number" },
      "shipperDetails": { "$first": "$shipper_details" },
      "latestMilestone": { "$first": "$milestones" }
    }   },   {
    $match: {
      "latestMilestone.status": status
    }   },   {
    $project: {
      "id": 1,
      "bookingNumber": 1,
      "shipperDetails": 1,
      "milestones": "$latestMilestone",
      "status": "$latestMilestone.status"
    }   } ]

Sample Successful Query in MongoDB Compass

Any insights regarding this delema will be highly appreciated. Thank you.

comments.body_markdown: Why `PID1` is `string` and  `PID2`, `PID3` is `integer` ?
comments.body: Why PID1 is string and PID2, PID3 is integer ?

answers.title: Jolt condition spec
answers.body:
You can use following spec:

If you want to change your output if MC in OTHER You can change second shift operation as you want.

[
  {
    "operation": "shift",
    "spec": {
      "@": "data[0]",
      "MC": {
        "OTHER": {
          "@3": "data[1]"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  {
    "operation": "shift",
    "spec": {
      "*": {
        "0": "&1[&]",
        "1": {
          "*": "&2[&1].&",
          "mProperty": {
            "PID1": {
              "#piid": "&4[&3].mDefintion.&2[#2].id.value",
              "@": "&4[&3].mDefintion.&2[#2].value[0].valueString.value"
            },
            "*": {
              "$": "&4[&3].mDefintion.&2[#2].id.value",
              "@": "&4[&3].mDefintion.&2[#2].value[0].valueString.value"
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  },
  {
    "operation": "modify-overwrite-beta",
    "spec": {
      "*": "=lastElement(@0)"
    }
  },
  {
    "operation": "shift",
    "spec": {
      "*": ""
    }
  }
]

items.title: Concurrency of two services that fetch files from one sftp via camel
items.body:
as said in the title, I have two services and each of them have a camel route inside that downloads files from sftp and processes them according to cron expression(they run at the same time). Problem is that despite of having idempotentConsumer in place, services seems to both take the same file and in logs I can see for example "No such file exception" when one instance was about to move or delete the file. I saw that there are options in camel to lets say lock the file but most of them work only for "file" component and not for sftp. Is there a way to assure that only one instance would processes the file without any errors or warnings? This is my configuration.

@Bean
public IdempotentRepository idempotentRepo(final DataSource dataSource) {
    JdbcMessageIdRepository idRepository = new JdbcMessageIdRepository(dataSource, PROCESSOR_RESPONSE);
    idRepository.setTableName("SCHEMA.CAMEL_MESSAGEPROCESSED");
    return idRepository;
}

And this is the route.

@Override
public void configure() {
    from("sftp?preferredAuthentications=password&password=${password}&scheduler=quartz&scheduler.cron=${cron}&useUserKnownHostsFile=false&delete=true&shuffle=true")
            .transacted()
            .idempotentConsumer(header("camelFileAbsolutePath"),
                    idempotentRepository)
            .eager(true)
            .routeId(RouteDownloadResponses.class.getSimpleName())
            .convertBodyTo(byte[].class)
            .andSoOn();
}

I saw a lot of posts how to set this up either in route option or using this consumer, but I did not find any solution that would work. Any help would be very appreciated. Thanks!

            drawer.closeDrawer(GravityCompat.START);
        } else {
            if (doubleBackToExitPressedOnce) {
                super.onBackPressed();
            }
            if (getSupportFragmentManager().getBackStackEntryCount() != 0) {
                String title;
                if(!(getSupportFragmentManager().getFragments().get(getSupportFragmentManager().getBackStackEntryCount()) instanceof SupportRequestManagerFragment)) {
                    title = getSupportFragmentManager().getFragments().get(getSupportFragmentManager().getBackStackEntryCount()).getTag();
                } else {
                    title = getSupportFragmentManager().getFragments().get(getSupportFragmentManager().getBackStackEntryCount()-1).getTag();
                }
                if (title != null) {
                    toolbar.setTitle(title);
                    setRequestedOrientation(ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT);
                    getWindow().clearFlags(1024);

                }
                super.onBackPressed();
            } else {
                this.doubleBackToExitPressedOnce = true;
                Toast.makeText(this, getResources().getString(R.string.Please_click_BACK_again_to_exit), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();

                new Handler().postDelayed(() -> doubleBackToExitPressedOnce = false, 2000);
            }
        }
    }

Normally when I run or test app, I am not getting any error but in Google console, I am getting error logged like this

items.title: My Spring Boot contoller health check fails even though its the same as the other one
items.body:
Here is a controller that works

@RestController
@RequestMapping(path = "api/v1/students")
public class StudentController {
    @GetMapping(value = "/health2")
    public String Health2() {
        return "Online!##@@@@"; // works!
    }

}

Now here is a controller that doesn't work


@RestController
@RequestMapping(path = "/api/v1/ws")
public class RecordingController {

  @GetMapping(value = "/health")
  public String foo() {
      return "Running";
  }
}

GET http://localhost:8080/api/v1/students/health2 <= "Online!##@@@@"

GET http://localhost:8080/api/v1/ws/health gives

{
    "timestamp": "2023-04-03T17:26:01.369+00:00",
    "status": 404,
    "error": "Not Found",
    "message": "No message available",
    "path": "/api/v1/ws/health"
}

How do I fix it please? My imports all work

My expectation is that copying the same forms into another controller will work identically to the previous one

My actual result is that the second controller fails but I dont know why

I tried it also as @RequestMapping(path = "api/v1/ws") but it still fails

I have restarted my server.

Edit: Solution

// package com.example.messagingstompwebsocket; // remove this
package hotjar.demo.student; // add this

comments.body_markdown: You are using a `CDATA` marked section.  This will cause any characters within it to be parsed as literal characters, and not to be interpreted by the markup parser.

items.title: JPA Repository @Autowired doesn't work and returns NullPointerException
items.body:
I have a simple model and repository that i want to test the "save" method:

@Data
@NoArgsConstructor
@RequiredArgsConstructor
@Entity
@Table(name = "TEST")
public class TestModel {

    @Id
    @NonNull
    @Basic(optional = false)
    @Column(name = "id")
    private String id;

    @NonNull
    @Basic(optional = false)
    @Column(name = "testValue")
    private String testValue;

}

@Repository
public interface TestRepository extends JpaRepository<TestModel, String> {

}

...and on the main class:

@SpringBootApplication
public class DemoApplication {

    @Autowired private static TestRepository testRepository;

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        SpringApplication.run(DemoApplication.class, args);

        TestModel testModel = new TestModel("1", "randomValue");

        testRepository.save(testModel);

    }

}

When i try to use the repository to save a simple object, it gaves me NullPointerException pointing to the autowired repository.

I've used so many annotations like ComponentScan (pointing to the repository package), EntityScan (pointing to the entity package) EnabledAutoConfiguration but no one of them works for me.

I'm using Spring Boot 2.7.10, Spring Data JPA and Spring Web as dependencies in pom.xml.

Someone knows what it should be? Thanks!

items.title: HTTP Status 500 - Internal Server Error:Error creating bean with name 'HomeController': Lookup method resolution failed
items.body:
I have some problems when trying to use @HttpSession in Spring MVC Controller. I want to cut the first letter of an email from login page to home page with session. To avoid session being null when loading first home page when loaded I used if condition but it gives this error: Error creating bean with name 'HomeController': Lookup method resolution failed

@Controller
@RequestMapping("/")
public class HomeController {
    @GetMapping
    @Transactional
    public String Default(@SessionAttribute("email") String email,ModelMap modelMap,HttpSession httpSession) {
        if(httpSession.getAttribute("email") != null) {
            String email =(String) httpSession.getAttribute("email");
            String chacracter = email.substring(0, 1);
            modelMap.addAttribute("chacracter ", chacracter );
        }
        return "home";
    }
}

answers.title: I try to find the reverse number of the input number in java program .Yeah but i am confused about the logic inside the loop
answers.body:
First of all you need every last element of that number so for that logic is below.

public class reverseNumber {
    public static void main(String[] args) {

         System.out.print("Enter a number :");
         Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
         int number = sc.nextInt();

         int reverse = 0;

        while (number != 0) {
            int remainder = number % 10;
            reverse = reverse * 10 + remainder;
            number = number / 10;
        }

        System.out.println("The reverse of the given number is: " + reverse);
    }
}

Logic Explanation

1. Loop runs until reverse variable will not 0.

while(number != 0)

2. This gives last number of that variable for Example. If we have 12345 then after this code line runs it gives 5 because when you do the number modulo 10 then it gives last one number.

int remainder = number % 10;

3. In this reverse variable we can store that last number.

reverse = reverse * 10 + remainder;

The value of the reverse is 0 at the start then remainder of first time is 5 so the value of the reverse is (reverse = 0 + 10 + 5) then at first time value of reverse is 5.

4. after that the original number is divided by 10 and remove last index of that number. for example 12345 then it removes 5 for that number and go on until the number is not 0.

number = number / 10;
